items.title: Hate laws to pass after Labor and Liberal deal
items.description: The Liberal Party struck an agreement with Labor to tighten the scope of a bill to ban hate groups, but the position of the Nationals is unclear.

items.title: 'Wasn't I smart': Hanson celebrates historic rise in polls
items.description: While she's made no secret of her desire to eventually unseat Anthony Albanese, the One Nation leader's immediate electoral strategy is to gain ground at upcoming state elections.

items.title: Surfers left 'rattled' after four NSW shark attacks
items.description: Four shark attacks have been documented within 48 hours at beaches across New South Wales, lifting the anxieties of swimmers and surfers who are considering a dip in the ocean.

items.title: Sydney protest restrictions extended with 'significantly limited' scope
items.description: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has announced restrictions on protests in parts of the state will be extended.

items.title: British-born Aussies giving up UK citizenship over new passport rules
items.description: Frustrated dual British-Australian citizens are weighing up their options in response to new passport rules. Here's why some are letting go of their British citizenship.

items.title: What is Trump's Board of Peace and why could it be threat to the UN?
items.description: Donald Trump appears to be trying to build his own international peacekeeping body, which he calls the "Board of Peace". Here's why experts think it might attempt to rival the UN.

items.title: Hackers disrupt Iranian state TV to support exiled prince
items.description: Hackers break into Iranian state television satellite transmissions to air footage supporting the country's exiled former prince and calling on security forces to lay down their weapons.

items.title: Council rejects push for $250k for Writers' Week replacement
items.description: Adelaide City Council commits to supporting, but not funding, a replacement event to fill the void left by Writers' Week, as the lord mayor describes the proposal as "not much more" than a "thought bubble".

items.title: Incoming NT administrator's past tweets slammed as 'reprehensible', 'offensive'
items.description: Past social media posts made by incoming Northern Territory administrator David Connolly have been labelled "reprehensible" by three federal politicians, who are also demanding he apologise.

items.title: Police say 'dingoes had physically been in contact' with dead woman
items.description: The woman was found surrounded by dingoes after going for an early-morning swim.

items.title: Live: Italian cut down by gut issues at Aus Open as Darderi sprints off court mid-celebration
items.description: Italian 22nd seed Luciano Darderi sprints off court straight after winning through to the second round of the Australian Open, as Madison Keys kicks off her title defence with a win. Follow live.

items.title: Live: BHP sets iron ore production record, IMF calls out Australia's 'drawn-out' inflation
items.description: The ASX trades flat on Tuesday. The International Monetary Fund says Australia, alongside Norway, is projected to see persistent above-target inflation. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: UN could investigate 'crimes against humanity' as Iran's death toll rises
items.description: An independent fact-finding mission should investigate potential crimes against humanity committed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, according a UN-appointed representative.

items.title: Brooklyn Beckham has cut ties with his famous parents. What can we learn from it?
items.description: Celebrity family rifts are not new. Experts weigh in on how they can spark negative feelings about our own family dynamics.

items.title: Climate change triggers 'remarkable response' from Antarctic penguins
items.description: Penguins in parts of Antarctica are breeding up to two weeks earlier than a decade ago, likely in response to climate change, according to a long-term study.

items.title: Known now for his signature red, it was an ivory wedding dress that brought Valentino fame
items.description: "Valentino red", now synonymous with the Italian designer, was introduced to the world in 1959. But it wasn't until years later he commanded true global attention — and with an entirely different dress.

items.title: That big sign on your lawn? It may be breaking planning rules
items.description: Talk may be cheap, but telling others what you think via permanent signage in your yard could be about to cost you big if you live in Hobart. Here is why.

items.title: ABC appoints Isabella Higgins as new host of AM program
items.description: The former Europe correspondent succeeds Sabra Lane, who has announced she will step down after nine years of presenting.

items.title: Sienna was diagnosed with brain cancer before her HSC. Now she's going to work in health
items.description: Just over a year ago Sienna was shocked to discover she had a rare brain cancer. She's taking a new drug to slow its growth, but it's come at great cost.

items.title: Women's football captain departs club over offensive 'Silly Saturday' costumes
items.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

items.title: First Nations woman asked about eating ants takes department to court
items.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

items.title: Man taken to hospital after crocodile attack in north Qld
items.description: It is understood the man in his 20s suffered puncture wounds to his lower back, upper legs and hand.

items.title: Driver may have stalled before fatal collision with train, police say
items.description: Police say "vehicle trouble" or "driver error" may have caused a collision between a car and a train west of Geelong on Tuesday morning that killed two people.

items.title: Man charged with murder one year after 'random' bushland attack
items.description: Police have charged a 29-year-old man after the alleged murder of a 60-year-old man, who was found with serious head injuries on a fire trail in Nowra in December 2024.

items.title: Parole Board seeks judicial review of decision blocking Snowtown killer's release
items.description: South Australia's Parole Board has confirmed it will lodge an application for a judicial review of the decision to keep the youngest of the Snowtown killers James Vlassakis behind bars.
